text: lately it seems like all we hear about
are the different ways the NSA is
hacking our cell phones apps like Angry
Birds are leaking personal information
even snapchat got hacked it is time to
lock it down here are some of my
favorite apps for encrypting at least
some of your cell phone communications
first up an all-in-one solution that
comes at a cost
silent circle is a subscription service
for the truly paranoid for $10 a month
it will encrypt your video texting and
calling but only if the person on the
other end is also a subscriber if you
upgrade to the $24 a month version then
you can encrypt your side of phone calls
to any mobile or landline even if the
other person doesn't use it if you just
want to encrypt your voice calls a free
alternative that I love is red phone now
the way red phone works is that it
integrates with your phones a standard
dialer but if you call someone who also
has the app installed you will get this
option to upgrade to a red phone call
and if you say yes please secure call
you hear this kind of cool dialing sound
like radar and then when they answer
boo-boo-boo we're encrypted I mean I
hope it's just music but now when it
comes to secure texting my favorite app
is sadly also Android only it's called
tech secure and it comes from the same
people who make red phone if the other
user has it installed it is super easy
to use it just encrypts texts back and
forth and it replaces your standard
texting app if you do want to talk to
someone on an iPhone you might want to
consider chat secure it's also free it's
available for iPhone and Android it
doesn't work by replacing texting it
actually sends encrypted messages over
Facebook Google jabber or a couple of
other clients these are just a few of
the apps that I like to help secure your
cell phone communications but remember
nothing is completely secure the
government or hackers could still break
encryption apps could be leaking your
personal data and don't forget the
lesson of Anthony Weiner security is
only as good as the person on the other
end
oh hey we're encrypted say whatever you
want
